issue.title: docs: usage: mnist: Finish tutorial

labels.name: kind/sources
labels.description: Issues partaining to the data sources

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

issue.body:
- For adding a section to tutorial on prediction. Complete the csv source modification and addition of configload for some image format that we can use
  - Need a picture of a handwritten digit in some file format
  - Need to write a ConfigLoader (see config/yaml) for whatever file extension you choose.
  - Make the configloader convert the file into the correct format (the array)
    - This means youâ€™ll have to parse the file format, there might be a library out there to help you do this.


Pining @sakshamarora1 because these are the next steps for MNIST (probably best to do this before #370)


Add config parameter which says which columns to treat as files (to be loaded via configloader of respective file extension).

Example parameter name of `loadfiles`

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/6d804a026a84ab94826d9d800e37638ef1d74020/dffml/source/csv.py#L47-L51

*test.csv*

```csv
key,filename
first,first.yaml
second,second.yaml
```

*first.yaml*

```yaml
hello: world
```

*second.yaml*

```yaml
hi: there
```

### Before this change

```console
$ dffml list repos -sources f=csv -source-filename test.csv
first
filename                      first.yaml
Predictions
Undetermined
second
filename                      second.yaml
Predictions
Undetermined
```

### After this change

```console
$ dffml list repos -sources f=csv -source-filename test.csv -source-loadfiles filename
first
filename                      {'hello': 'world'}
Predictions
Undetermined
second
filename                      {'hi': 'there'}
Predictions
Undetermined
```

Create a new config loader, change the body of `loadb` to make it parse the bytes into a valid array (which you should convert to `list` rather than `ndarray` before returning).

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/6d804a026a84ab94826d9d800e37638ef1d74020/dffml/skel/config/REPLACE_IMPORT_PACKAGE_NAME/config.py#L13-L15

Then modify csv source to use `ConfigLoaders` to load the filename (for all columns in `loadfiles`)

Example:

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/6d804a026a84ab94826d9d800e37638ef1d74020/tests/config/test_config_loader.py#L36-L59

issue.title: WIP: Reading PNG images as arrays for MNIST Prediction

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

issue.body:
For Issue #371 

Create image.csv
```console
cat > image.csv << EOF
key, image
four, image1.png
five, image2.png
three, image3.png
two, image4.png
EOF
```
After training on the MNIST dataset ,
Predict command : 
```console
dffml predict all \
-model tfdnnc \
-model-batchsize 1000 \
-model-hidden 30 50 25 \
-model-clstype int \
-model-predict label:int:1 \
-model-classifications $(seq 0 9) \
-model-features image:int:$((28 * 28)) \
-sources images=csv \
-source-filename image.csv  \
-source-loadfiles image  \
-log debug
```

body: @pdxjohnny correct me if I am wrong but isn't this what operations target to achieve, like we run some operations and then pass it to the model!?

issue.title: arch: df: Implement a way to use data flow for transformation of existing datasets

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

issue.body: Say we have the a dataset generated by `dffml-feature-git` and want to take 10 quarters down to 1 data point for each feature. There is someway that we could use `dff` to do this. Probably with operations similar to output operations? Lets brainstorm here.

rename.to: cli: dataflow: Shorthand for create command

body:
We talked about this in 2021-05-11 meeting. We decided that instead of this issue being about a new source, this issue should be about making a shorthand for the `dffml dataflow create` command. We can then use the dataflow that this new shorthand outputs with the existing (which didn't exist at time of issue creation) DataFlowSource.

We can also modify the DataFlowSource to inspect the InputFlow objects to see which definition names it's expecting from `seed`. We can use this list of defintion names as the feature names to grab from each record and assign the corresponding definition name. If there are `-inputs` that also contain values with those definitions, we shouldn't grab that feature from each record.
